paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR Val122Ile variant, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: transthyretin amyloidosis, associated with multiple outpatient surgeries

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In male subjects (carriers n = 80, non-carriers n = 2357), the I122 allele was associated with a 15.2-fold increase in the odds of having 10 or more outpatient surgeries.

individual_records.phenotype_details: no Val122Ile carriers had more than 10 outpatient surgeries
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In female sample (carriers n = 72, non-carriers n = 1852), no Val122Ile carriers had more than 10 outpatient surgeries.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation is associated with increased risk of multiple outpatient surgeries and heart disease.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the studied cohort.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the role of non-coding variants in modulating the effects of the Val122Ile mutation.
key_quotes: The I122 allele was associated with a 6.9-fold increase in the odds of having 10 or more outpatient surgeries.
In male subjects, the I122 allele was associated with a 15.2-fold increase in the odds of having 10 or more outpatient surgeries.

tables_processed.table_caption: Characteristics of the sample investigated, including demographics and Val122Ile frequency.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and tables.
